Module com.arobertson.software_ii__c195
Package arobertson.C195.Utilities

Class Alerts

java.lang.Object
arobertson.C195.Utilities.Alerts
public class Alerts extends Object
Utility class for displaying various types of alerts to the user.

      Resource bundle for managing localized language strings.

  • Constructor Details

    • Alerts

      public Alerts()

  • Method Details

    • alertConfirm

      public static boolean alertConfirm(int confirmationId)
      Displays a confirmation alert with customizable messages based on the provided ID.
      Parameters:
      confirmationId - An integer identifying the type of confirmation needed. 1: Cancel confirmation. 2: Deletion confirmation.
      Returns:
      true if the user clicks the OK button, false otherwise.

    • alertWarning

      public static void alertWarning(int warningId)
      Displays a warning alert with customizable messages based on the provided ID.
      Parameters:
      warningId - An integer identifying the type of warning to display. 1: Selection warning for updating an appointment. 2: Selection warning for updating a customer. 3: Selection warning for deleting an appointment. 4: Selection warning for deleting a customer.

    • alertInfo

      public static void alertInfo(int infoId)
      Displays an information alert with customizable messages based on the provided ID.
      Parameters:
      infoId - An integer identifying the type of information to display. 1: Success message for adding an appointment. 2: Success message for updating an appointment. 3: Success message for deleting an appointment. 4: Success message for adding a customer. 5: Success message for updating a customer. 6: Success message for deleting a customer.

    • alertError

      public static void alertError(int errorId)
      Displays an error alert with customizable messages based on the provided ID. The error messages for credential issues are localized based on the current locale.
      Parameters:
      errorId - An integer identifying the type of error to display. 1: Error for a blank username. 2: Error for a blank password. 3: Error for invalid credentials. 4: Error indicating failure to update tables. 5: Error indicating failure to add data to a table. 6: Error indicating failure to update data in a table. 7: Error indicating failure to delete data in a table. 8: Error indicating a conflicting customer appointment schedule. 9: Error indicating failure to add an appointment. 10: Error indicating failure to load appointment data. 11: Error indicating failure to load customer data. 12: Generic error indicating failure to delete a record. 13: Error indicating that customers with existing appointments cannot be deleted. 14: Error indicating failure to add a customer.

    • alertErrorInputs

      public static void alertErrorInputs(String additionalMessage)
      Displays an error alert specifically for input validation failures, including an additional message.
      Parameters:
      additionalMessage - A String containing additional information about the input error.

    • alertExit

      public static void alertExit(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Displays a warning alert to confirm application exit. If the user confirms, the database connection is closed and the stage is closed. The alert message is localized.
      Parameters:
      stage - The primary stage of the application.

    • alertLogout

      public static void alertLogout(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws SQLException, IOException
      Displays a warning alert to confirm user logout. If the user confirms, the current stage is closed, the database connection is closed, and a new instance of the main application is started on the same stage.
      Parameters:
      stage - The current stage of the application.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while closing the database connection.
      IOException - If an error occurs while starting the new main application.

    • alertUpcomingApps

      public static void alertUpcomingApps()
      Checks for any appointments starting within the next 15 minutes and displays an informational alert. If an upcoming appointment is found, the alert will display the appointment ID and start time in the format "MM-dd-yyy HH:mm". If no upcoming appointments are found, a corresponding message is displayed. The alert messages are localized.
